column4: i'm unable to switch icon themes 80% of them show the base gnome grey icons, ideas?
what icon theme gives you this problem?
blankon, dropline neu, dropline nuovo, gperfection2, humility, suede... they change some icons, but not folder icons...
roger. i'm really not to sure. have you considered renaming your ~/.icons and ~/.themes directories and trying again?

since they do seem to work to some degree, i take it that if you do the following command --> dpkg -L gnome-humility-icon-theme | grep index   ...that you get the following output --> /usr/share/icons/Humility/index.theme  ..but thought maybe i should check anyway
indeed thats the output... is that right?
yes.. that's correct
have you installed any icon sets or themes from source? as in a .tar.gz file?
nope... all from repos
roger. i don't know really. strange. i just tried the 'Nuvola' theme here. worked fine, icons and all
have you looked in your ~/.icons and ~/.themes directories? you probably don't have anything in there if you haven't installed any .tar.gz themes/icon sets
this weird behaviour started in karmic, i've updated a few days ago and decided to check... and stillhappends :s
so, you running on an upgrade ?
roger that
icons folder doesn't have anything but themes has a few subfolders
roger. consider renaming that directory, then choosing a new theme
renamed both, no effect :O
roger. you could go to drastic measures short of reinstalling

you could go to drastic measures short of reinstalling fresh and clean, which to me, would be.. to exit out of X-Windows.. at virtual terminal do the following --> rm -rf .cache .config .gconf .gconfd .gnome2* .icons .local .nautilus .themes  ...or something of that nature. you probably get the idea
yeah... what bastidrazor said.. test out a new user. see if your theme icons work ok for newly created user
